head.supplied: October 7th [186]2 ¶ Sir ¶ ¶ I have the honor to acknowledge the receipt of your letter addressed to the Committee of the Royal Park. As this is a matter which entirely concerns the Trustees appointe...

div.p: No. 62/723, unit 2, p. 4, VPRS 2225 outward letter press copy books, Acclimatisation Society of Victoria, Public Record Office, Victoria.

I have the honor to acknowledge the receipt of your letter addressed to the Committee of the Royal Park. As this is a matter which entirely concerns the Trustees appointed by the Government I have forwarded the letter to the Hony Secretary viz Dr Mueller.

At the same time I would observe that after the interview I had with Mr Judd and yourself I did my utmost to stay proceedings and succeeded and was greatly surprised that after all this trouble you refused to give up the saddle and take Mr Smith's word that the money should be refunded. Accordingly there was no alternative but to let the law take its course.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: I have the honor to be

div.p:
Richmond
See also 4 December 1862, copy of letter sent to the Argus [VPRS 2225, unit 2, pp. 170-2, Public Record Office, Victoria]. The saddle had been stolen, pawned and turned up in Harding's shop.
